task_summary: Pick up the red cylindrical object from the table using a robotic manipulator.

task_long_description.overview: This episode demonstrates a robotic arm executing a sequential pick operation on a red cylindrical object placed on a black table with marked blue tape areas. The robot must perceive, precisely approach, grasp, lift, and retreat from the object. Adherence to safe grasp forces and motion timing is crucial to ensure reliability without collision.
preconditions: Red object is present on the table within reach.
Gripper is initially open and unobstructed.
Robot and scene are free from obstacles.
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the red object; scan if needed.
Detect and localize the red object.
Open the gripper for grasp preparation.
Move above the object to a safe offset.
Approach and align to the object with tight tolerance.
Lower gripper until contact is sensed.
Close gripper gently to grasp the object.
Verify stable grasp and confirm object in gripper.
success_criteria: Red object is securely held in the gripper.
Object is lifted cleanly from the table surface.
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: trigger scan sequence.
Grasp instability: retry or abandon pick.
task_long_description.termination: Sequence ends when the object is successfully grasped, lifted, and retreated from its pickup location.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is currently visible to perception.
Pan/scan the workspace to locate the red object.
Finalize precise detection and localization of the red object.
Open gripper in preparation for grasping.
Move end-effector above the object to a safe vertical offset.
Compute a grasp pose from above (top grasp).
Approach and align gripper precisely to the object's centroid.
Lower gripper until gentle contact is made against the object.
Close gripper to grasp object using minimum allowed force.
Check if grasp is robust without slippage.
Confirm object is held within the gripper.
Retract the end-effector away from the pickup site.

failure_modes: Gripper fails to close or slips
Collision with blue object or table
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for object visibility, up to three attempts
Lift and reopen gripper and retry if instability detected
assumptions: Frames confirm red object presence and approach sequence; no contradictory cues found.
No pick-and-place transfer: only pickup, as per episode frames.
Object geometry inferred as 'red_object' cylinder, symbolic name.
Blue object is present but not an active target in this episode.

expected_success_criteria: Red object grasped and lifted from table.
Proper gripper force and motion constraints applied.
